meanings.definition: The act of grafting or inserting tissue or cells into a living body.
meanings.sent1: The engraftment of new skin onto the burn victim's body helped in the healing process.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon performed the engraftment of a healthy kidney into the patient's body.
meanings.sent3: The engraftment of the seed into the soil was like a tiny plant getting a cozy home.
meanings.sent4: Her engraftment of kindness into every action made her a beloved figure in the community.
meanings.sent5: The engraftment of the idea into their minds sparked a wave of creativity.

meanings.definition: The process of establishing or incorporating something into a larger whole.
meanings.sent1: The engraftment of new policies into the company's structure brought about positive changes.
meanings.sent2: The engraftment of diverse cultures into the city's fabric enriched its identity.
meanings.sent3: The engraftment of humor into the serious meeting lightened the mood.
meanings.sent4: The engraftment of technology into everyday life has revolutionized how we communicate.
meanings.sent5: The engraftment of teamwork into the project ensured its success.
